text:
Message 1558 of 4024
You know, July 5 threw me a curveball. That I was so sure would never happen in my lifetime. But I understand your position, I wish you could’ve
told me and we worked it out, but I respect you.
What I can’t stand now, is the way our lives have unfolded since we’ve let others dictate our every move. Once so close, so strong, so passionate for
one another. We can’t even talk for two minutes.
We should be discussing how we want to creatively divvy things up for longtime financial success. And where we see the boys in five years and how
we get them there. And long term co-existence.
There is no reason for continuing this horrible, shitty relationship. We have the power to take it back and be kind to each other. we are choosing to
ruin our lives and our kids along with happy and memories.
I really really hope that someday we can look back on this and give ourselves a score. How we handled it. Were we gracious? Or mean and
machiavellian? We are writing the next chapter for Big and Little.
Is this really how you want it to read in the end?
I’m always here if you want to try something new...
Sent:02/22/2024 at 06:24 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/22/2024 at 06:36 PM)
Subject:Bummer..
Message 1559 of 4024
The last thing I heard was SAAS had requested Adrian's 21/22 transcript from Lakeview. That was on Tuesday, four days ago.
Feels like we need to nudge for a status update, but I guess that’s your call if this goes the way of the summer camps or not.

From:Robert Moyer
